title: Sri Lanka central bank denies rift between Governor and PM
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s central bank has denied there was a rift between Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe following speculation that attempts were underway to remove him.

“CBSL was made to understand on certain news items circulating in social media that there is a dispute between the Governor and the Hon. Prime Minister, Ranil Wickremesinghe,” the central bank said in a twitter.com message.
“The Governor vehemently rejects such assertions and reiterates that the cordial relationship between him and the Hon. Prime Minister continues in every respect to restore the Sri Lankan economy.”
There had been speculation that intense speculation that Governor Weerasinghe will not be re-appointed once his term – which is the balance portion of a previous term – ends.
Governor Weerasinghe is a career central banker who has served under different administrations. (Colombo/June08/2022)
